column4: where can i  find  a guide to using ssh to manage a ubuntu server from an xp box?
grab a copy of putty for windows (and xming if you want to use gui apps) and you are good to go
if you put putty.exe in %WINDIR% you can then use: putty -X name@server
provided xming is running, you will be able to launch gui apps as well as use the terminal
nope, just use your logon passwords
